hypothesis: Stockard Channing was in movies.
premise: + Jack (2004 film) + Jack is a 2004 American drama TV film written by A. M. Homes and directed by Lee Rose . + Stockard Channing + She is known for playing Betty Rizzo in the film Grease ( 1978 ) and First Lady Abbey Bartlet on the NBC television series The West Wing ( 1999 - 2006 ) . + Stockard Channing + Her film appearances include The Fortune ( 1975 ) , The Big Bus ( 1976 ) , The Cheap Detective ( 1978 ) , Heartburn ( 1986 ) , Up Close & Personal ( 1996 ) , Practical Magic ( 1998 ) , and Woody Allen 's Anything Else ( 2003 ) . + Stockard Channing + She is also known for originating the role of Ouisa Kittredge in the stage and film versions of Six Degrees of Separation , for which she was nominated for a Tony Award and the Academy Award for Best Actress . + Grease (film) + Grease is a 1978 American musical romantic comedy film based on Jim Jacobs and Warren Casey 's musical of the same name .
explanation_1: Stockard Channing has been in movies, but it does not say whether she was in Jack ( 2004 film ) .

hypothesis: The Portuguese Empire was one of world history's largest empires.
premise: + Portuguese Empire + The Portuguese Empire ( Império Português ) , also known as the Portuguese Overseas ( Ultramar Português ) , was one of the largest and longest-lived empires in world history and the first colonial empire of the Renaissance . + List of largest empires + This is a list of the largest empires in world history , but the list is not and can not be definitive since the decision about which entities to consider as `` empires '' is difficult and fraught with controversy .
explanation_1: The Portuguese Empire was one of the largest empires in world history.

hypothesis: Divergent is a motion picture.
premise: + Divergent (film) + Divergent is a 2014 American science fiction action film directed by Neil Burger , based on the novel of the same name by Veronica Roth . + The Divergent Series + The Divergent Series is a feature film series based on the Divergent novels by the American author Veronica Roth . + Neil Burger + Neil Burger ( born Neil Norman Burger ) is an American film and television director , writer and producer known for the fake-documentary Interview with the Assassin ( 2002 ) , the period drama The Illusionist ( 2006 ) , Limitless ( 2011 ) , and the sci-fi action film Divergent ( 2014 ) , based on the dystopian novel of the same name by Veronica Roth . + Science fiction film + Science fiction film ( or sci-fi ) is a genre that uses speculative , fictional science-based depictions of phenomena that are not fully accepted by mainstream science , such as extraterrestrial lifeforms , alien worlds , extrasensory perception and time travel , along with futuristic elements such as spacecraft , robots , cyborgs , interstellar travel or other technologies . + Divergent (film) + The film is the first installment in The Divergent Series and was produced by Lucy Fisher , Pouya Shabazian , and Douglas Wick , with a screenplay by Evan Daugherty and Vanessa Taylor .
explanation_1: Divergent is a 2014 American science fiction action film directed by Neil Burger.

hypothesis: Britney Spears was born on May 2nd, 1981.
premise: + Britney Spears + Britney Jean Spears ( born December 2 , 1981 ) is an American singer , dancer , and actress .
explanation_1: Britney Spears was born on December 2, 1981.

hypothesis: AC/DC was co-founded by Malcolm Young.
premise: + AC/DC + AC/DC are an Australian rock band , formed in 1973 by brothers Malcolm and Angus Young . + Malcolm Young + Malcolm Mitchell Young ( born 6 January 1953 ) is an Australian retired musician and songwriter , best known as a co-founder , rhythm guitarist , backing vocalist and songwriter for the hard rock band AC/DC . + Angus Young + Angus McKinnon Young ( born 31 March 1955 ) is an Australian guitarist , best known as the co-founder , lead guitarist , songwriter and only remaining original member of the Australian hard rock band AC/DC .
explanation_1: AC/DC was co-founded by Malcolm Young and his brother Angus Young.

hypothesis: Jack Black has been nominated for Awards.
premise: + Jack Black + He has been nominated for two Golden Globe Awards .
explanation_1: Jack Black has been nominated for two Golden Globe Awards.

hypothesis: Beijing is the country's center of education.
premise: + Beijing + Beijing is the second largest Chinese city by urban population after Shanghai and is the nation 's political , cultural , and educational centre . + List of universities and colleges in Beijing + This article is a list of universities and colleges in Beijing .
explanation_1: Beijing is the country's political, cultural and educational centre.

hypothesis: Timber is a song that was released in 2013.
premise: + Timber (Pitbull song) + The song was released on October 7 , 2013 , as the lead single from Pitbull 's extended play ( EP ) Meltdown . + Meltdown (EP) + Meltdown is an extended play ( EP ) by American rapper Pitbull , released on November 22 , 2013 through Mr. 305 , Polo Grounds , and RCA Records .
explanation_1: Timber was released on October 7, 2013.

hypothesis: A person was a music video director.
premise: + Spike Jonze + Spike Jonze ( pronounced `` Jones ''  born Adam Spiegel on October 22 , 1969 ) is an American director , producer , screenwriter and actor , whose work includes music videos , commercials , film and television . + Music video director + Directors , including Michel Gondry , Spike Jonze , and F. Gary Gray , have gone on to direct feature films , continuing a trend that had begun earlier with directors such as Lasse Hallström and David Fincher . + Mark Romanek + Mark Romanek ( born September 18 , 1959 ) is an American filmmaker whose directing work includes feature films , television , music videos and commercials . + Directors Label + Directors Label is a series of DVDs devoted to notable music video directors . + Michel Gondry + Michel Gondry (  born 8 May 1963 ) is a French independent film director , screenwriter , and producer .
explanation_1: A person was a music video director, but it does not say whether he was a director of Michel Gondry, Spike Jonze or Mark Romanek.

hypothesis: The Gadsden flag is made out of rattlesnakes.
premise: + Gadsden flag + The Gadsden flag is a historical American flag with a yellow field depicting a rattlesnake coiled and ready to strike .
explanation_1: The Gadsden flag is not made out of rattlesnakes.

hypothesis: Agatha Christie was an essay writer.
premise: + Agatha Christie + Dame Agatha Mary Clarissa Christie , Lady Mallowan , DBE ( née Miller ; 15 September 1890 - 12 January 1976 ) was an English crime novelist , short story writer and playwright .
explanation_1: Agatha Christie was a crime novelist, short story writer and playwright. She was not an essay writer.

hypothesis: Tokyo Ghoul was reviewed by Masataka Kubota.

explanation_1: Masataka Kubota reviewed Tokyo Ghoul, but it does not say whether he liked it or not.

hypothesis: Matt Kuchar played on the Citywide Tour.
premise: + Matt Kuchar + Matthew Gregory Kuchar ( born June 21 , 1978 ) is an American professional golfer who plays on the PGA Tour and formerly the Nationwide Tour .
explanation_1: Matt Kuchar played on the Nationwide Tour, not on the Citywide Tour.

hypothesis: The Breakfast Club is a novel.
premise: + The Breakfast Club + The Breakfast Club is a 1985 American coming-of-age comedy-drama film written , produced , and directed by John Hughes , starring Emilio Estevez , Paul Gleason , Anthony Michael Hall , Judd Nelson , Molly Ringwald and Ally Sheedy . + Brat Pack (actors) + The Brat Pack is a nickname given to a group of young actors who frequently appeared together in teen-oriented coming-of-age films in the 1980s . + National Film Registry + The National Film Registry ( NFR ) is the United States National Film Preservation Board 's ( NFPB ) selection of films for preservation in the Library of Congress . + Universal Pictures + Universal Pictures ( also referred to as Universal Studios or simply Universal ) is an American film studio owned by Comcast through the Universal Filmed Entertainment Group division of its wholly owned subsidiary NBCUniversal . + Brat Pack (actors) + First mentioned in a 1985 New York magazine article , it is now usually defined as the cast members of two specific films released in 1985 - The Breakfast Club and St. Elmo 's Fire - although other actors are sometimes included .
explanation_1: The Breakfast Club is a 1985 American coming-of-age comedy-drama film written, produced and directed by John Hughes. It does not say whether it is a novel.

hypothesis: Michelle Williams is a singer.
premise: + Michelle Williams (singer) + Tenitra Michelle Williams ( born July 23 , 1980 ) is an American recording artist , record producer , songwriter , and actress . + Michelle Williams (singer) + In 2015 , Williams sang for U.S. President Barack Obama & First Lady Michelle Obama at the White House .
explanation_1: Michelle Williams is a singer, however she is also an actress and a record producer.

hypothesis: Orson Welles was a Marxist stage actor.
premise: + Orson Welles + Known for his baritone voice , Welles was an actor in radio and film , a Shakespearean stage actor , and a magician noted for presenting troop variety shows in the war years . + Orson Welles + George Orson Welles (  May 6 , 1915 - October 10 , 1985 ) was an American actor , director , writer , and producer who worked in theatre , radio , and film . + The Mercury Wonder Show + The Mercury Wonder Show for Service Men was a 1943 magic-and-variety stage show by the Mercury Theatre , produced by Orson Welles and Joseph Cotten as a morale-boosting entertainment for US soldiers in World War II .
explanation_1: Orson Welles was a stage actor, however he was not a Marxist.

hypothesis: Mel Brooks is a squid.
premise: + Mel Brooks + Melvin Brooks ( né Kaminsky , born June 28 , 1926 ) is an American filmmaker , comedian , actor and composer . + Mel Brooks + He is known as a creator of broad film farces and comic parodies . + Emmy Award + An Emmy Award , or simply Emmy , is an American award that recognizes excellence in the television industry , and corresponds to the ( likewise American ) Academy Award ( for film ) , the Tony Award ( for theatre ) , and the Grammy Award ( for music ) . + Mel Brooks + Brooks began his career as a comic and a writer for the early TV variety show Your Show of Shows . + Young Frankenstein + Young Frankenstein is a 1974 American comedy horror film directed by Mel Brooks and starring Gene Wilder as the title character , a descendant of the infamous Dr. Victor Frankenstein .
explanation_1: Mel Brooks is a human being.

hypothesis: Mother Teresa lived most of her life in Ireland.
premise: + Mother Teresa + After living in Macedonia for eighteen years she moved to Ireland and then to India , where she lived for most of her life . + India + India , officially the Republic of India ( Bhārat Gaṇarājya '' ) , is a country in South Asia .
explanation_1: Mother Teresa lived most of her life in India.

hypothesis: Tropic Thunder's soundtrack was released in 2010.
premise: + Tropic Thunder + The film 's soundtrack and score debuted on August 5 , 2008 , before the film 's theatrical release . + Tropic Thunder + Tropic Thunder is a 2008 satirical action comedy film co-written , produced , and directed by Ben Stiller .
explanation_1: Tropic Thunder's soundtrack was released in 2008, before the film's theatrical release.

hypothesis: Portugal is not the 5th most peaceful country in the world.
premise: + Portugal + It is the 5th most peaceful country in the world , maintaining a unitary semi-presidential republican form of government . + Global Peace Index + The Global Peace Index ( GPI ) is an attempt to measure the relative position of nations ' and regions ' peacefulness .

hypothesis: Death in Paradise (TV series) was created by an Australian screenwriter.
premise: + Death in Paradise (TV series) + Death in Paradise is a British-French crime comedy-drama television series created by Robert Thorogood , starring Ben Miller ( series 1 - 3 ) , Kris Marshall ( series 3 - 6 ) & Ardal O'Hanlon ( series 6 - present ) . + Robert Thorogood + Robert Thorogood is an English screenwriter .
explanation_1: Robert Thorogood is an English screenwriter.

hypothesis: Toy Story is strictly a computer-animated novel.
premise: + Toy Story + Toy Story is a 1995 American computer-animated buddy comedy adventure film produced by Pixar Animation Studios and released by Walt Disney Pictures . + Pixar + Pixar  , also referred to as Pixar Animation Studios , is an American computer animation film studio based in Emeryville , California that is a subsidiary of The Walt Disney Company . + Toy Story + The directorial debut of John Lasseter , Toy Story was the first feature-length computer-animated film and the first theatrical film produced by Pixar . + Computer-generated imagery + Computer-generated imagery ( CGI ) is the application of computer graphics to create or contribute to images in art , printed media , video games , films , television programs , shorts , commercials , videos , and simulators .
explanation_1: Toy Story is a computer-animated film, but it is not a computer-animated novel.

hypothesis: Stephen Hawking is not British.
premise: + Stephen Hawking + Stephen William Hawking , ( born 8 January 1942 ) is an English theoretical physicist , cosmologist , author and Director of Research at the Centre for Theoretical Cosmology within the University of Cambridge . + Stephen Hawking + In 2002 , Hawking was ranked number 25 in the BBC 's poll of the 100 Greatest Britons .
explanation_1: Hawking was born in Oxford, England.
